backendDatabase

Class StatisticsBackend

  • java.lang.Object
    • backendDatabase.StatisticsBackend

  • public class StatisticsBackend
extends java.lang.Object
    The class writes and reads to the mySQL database for only the statistics information of a specific player.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StatisticsBackend()
      The constructor of a backend statistics in order to communicate with the statistics database.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean createPlayerStats(java.lang.String newUsername)
      The method creates a player statistics entry for each player in the database
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getGlobalHighScore()
      The method gets the top global high scores currently saved in all the database
      int getScore(java.lang.String username, int rank)
      The method returns 1-10th score,depending on rank, of the current player or -1 if there is a problem
      boolean removePlayerStats(java.lang.String username)
      The method completely removes a player's statistics entry from the database
      boolean setScore(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String databaseField, int score)
      The method sets the score of a given username in the sorted rank of the player's top 10 highscores

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StatisticsBackend

        public StatisticsBackend()
        The constructor of a backend statistics in order to communicate with the statistics database. It establish the connection with the database

    • Method Detail

      • createPlayerStats

        public boolean createPlayerStats(java.lang.String newUsername)
        The method creates a player statistics entry for each player in the database
        Parameters:
        newUsername - the new username that needs to have an entry initialized in the database
        Returns:
        true if the player's entry was created in the database, false otherwise

      • removePlayerStats

        public boolean removePlayerStats(java.lang.String username)
        The method completely removes a player's statistics entry from the database
        Parameters:
        username - the username that needs to be removed fromt the statistics database
        Returns:
        true if the player was removed, false otherwise

      • getScore

        public int getScore(java.lang.String username,
           int rank)
        The method returns 1-10th score,depending on rank, of the current player or -1 if there is a problem
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the score that needs to be pulled
        rank - a dummy variable used to pull the 1st-10th highscore field of a username's top highscores
        Returns:
        the score currently saved in the field

      • setScore

        public boolean setScore(java.lang.String username,
               java.lang.String databaseField,
               int score)
        The method sets the score of a given username in the sorted rank of the player's top 10 highscores
        Parameters:
        username - the username which needs to set a new score in his database
        rank - a dummy variable to change the 1st-10th personal high score field
        score - the new score that needs to be inputted into the top personal highscores
        Returns:
        true if the score was set correctly, false otherwise

      • getGlobalHighScore

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getGlobalHighScore()
        The method gets the top global high scores currently saved in all the database
        Returns:
        the array list with the top 10 highscores and their respective usernames
